articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Law enforcement officials in Los Angeles began deploying "less lethal" munitions on Sunday as they clashed with crowds protesting federal immigration raids.
articles.title: What are the 'less lethal' weapons used by law enforcement in Los Angeles protests?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Sudanese military said that rebel paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF), backed by eastern Libyan forces under military commander Khalifa Haftar, had attacked Sudanese border posts on the Egyptian and Libyan frontiers on Tuesday, according to a statement.
articles.title: Sudanese military says rival paramilitary forces, backed by Libya's Haftar forces, attacked border posts

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Russia launched another prolonged drone attack on Ukraine, killing one person and damaging swathes of Kyiv as well as striking a maternity ward in the southern port of Odesa, regional officials said early on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's latest drone strikes hit Kyiv, maternity ward in Odesa, Ukraine says

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Jorge Garcia, Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: Hundreds of U.S. Marines arrived in Los Angeles overnight and more were expected on Tuesday under orders from President Donald Trump, who has also activated 4,000 National Guard troops to quell protests despite objections from California Governor Gavin Newsom and other local leaders.
articles.title: Marines arrive in LA under Trump orders as protests spread to other cities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least five people have been killed in an attack at a school in the Austrian city of Graz and others were injured, Austrian media including tabloid Kronen Zeitung reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: Five killed, others injured in Austrian school attack, media report

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg was deported from Israel on Tuesday, the day after the Israeli navy prevented her and a group of fellow pro-Palestinian activists from sailing to Gaza.
articles.title: Greta Thunberg deported from Israel, denounces Gaza 'war crimes'

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Sachin Ravikumar
articles.description: Britain and four other nations on Tuesday imposed sanctions on two far-right Israeli ministers, Itamar Ben-Gvir and Bezalel Smotrich, accusing them of repeatedly inciting violence against Palestinians in the West Bank.
articles.title: Britain sanctions Israeli far-right ministers over Gaza comments

articles.author: Karen Lema, Mikhail Flores
articles.description: Philippine senators were preparing to be sworn in as jurors in Wednesday's impeachment trial of Vice President Sara Duterte, who faces a lifetime political ban if convicted of high crimes and betraying the public trust.
articles.title: Philippine senators prepare to be jurors in Sara Duterte's impeachment trial

articles.author: Hatem Khaled, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: When university professor Nizam Salama made his way to a southern Gaza aid point last week, he came under fire twice, was crushed in a desperate crowd of hungry people and finally left empty handed.
articles.title: Palestinians' dangerous ordeal to reach Israeli-approved aid

articles.author: Sonia Rolley, David Lewis
articles.description: The United States is promoting a deal that would require Rwanda to pull troops from eastern Congo before the two sides sign a peace agreement, sources say, a condition that is sure to rankle Kigali, which describes Congo-based armed groups as an existential threat.
articles.title: US wants Rwandan troops out of Congo before peace deal signed, sources say
